talk0013:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Other than that, you'd be all set!
You can surf the desert dunes to your
heart's content!
talk0014:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Sand seals are especially sensitive to the
sounds around them.

The trick is to approach very,
very slowly...
talk0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It's a bit of a pain in the neck though,
so most everyone in town prefers to rent
one instead.
talk0016:
<sp:3:0:2:0400>If you go for a casual stroll in the desert
at this time of night, you'll freeze in
no time!
SunaTalk00:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>A sand seal or a sleigh seal—<sp:5:0:0>what are
you thinking?
SunaTalk01:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal>Oh...you should probably equip a shield.
You'll need one if you want to go sand-
seal surfing.
I can sell you one though! It'd bring the
total to <clr:0000>50 rupees<clr:ffff><sp:5:0:0>, but you really need it
to surf. What do you say?
SunaTalk02:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Notice>You know, if you're a little strapped for
rupees, you could always go visit one of
the shops and sell a thing or two.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I'm sure you're carrying all sorts of things
that folks would be interested in buying—<sp:5:1:0>
see if you can raise the rupees you need!
talk0019:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_00>What? But if you didn't rent one...


<sp:0:2:2:5000><clr:0200>No, he couldn't have found a wild one. The
sand shroud has made it almost impossible
to track them down...
Does that mean he walked?<sp:5:1:0> Ha, that's even harder
to believe than him finding a wild sand seal!<clr:ffff>

<sp:3:0:2:0701><sp:0:2:2:6400>Oh, you voe! Are all of you such
pranksters?<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:0:2:2:6400>
SunaTalk03:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>All right then, I hope you and your little
sand seal have an amazing trip!

You'll depart through the east gate!
talk0020:
<sp:3:0:2:0400>Oh, you're the voe from before, right?
For some reason I thought you'd left
town. Did you come back?
I can't believe you're just traveling around
in this sand shroud without a worry...

<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Notice_00>Oh! <sp:5:1:0>Did you rent a sand seal to
get around?
SunaTalk05:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Before I forget, if you try riding using a
shield that has stuff attached to it, you're
probably going to eat sand. Trust me.
talk0022:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Then you visited the shop my mom runs at
the entrance to the desert!

Sarqso for everything!
talk0023:
You obviously must have rented one from
the shop near the <clr:0000>entrance to the desert<clr:ffff>!
It's the only answer that makes sense.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Sarqso for your business!
SunaTalk07:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:Notice>Oh! It looks like you've already got plenty
of shields in your pouch.

<sp:3:0:2:0800>You don't need to bother getting one from
me then! Just equip one of the ones you
have, and then talk to me!
talk0024:
You obviously must have rented one from
the shop near the <clr:0000>entrance to the desert<clr:ffff>!
It's the only answer that makes sense.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>My mom runs that shop! Sarqso for
your business!
talk0025:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Sand seals are special animals that live in
the Gerudo Desert.

I'm sure you've noticed your feet getting
stuck in the sand when you walk across
the dunes, right?
Well, not only do these little ones call
the desert their home but they breeze
through it with ease!
That's only one reason that they're vital
to our way of life!

<sp:3:0:2:0700>And they aren't easy to catch and train
either! It takes a lot of work!

Luckily, folks like me are happy to do it.
I'm proud of the sand seals I've trained,
and I'm happy to rent them to travelers!
talk0026:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Yup! <sp:5:0:0>You'll often see them if you're out
wandering in the desert.

But they're extremely wary creatures.<sp:5:0:0>
If they notice you, they'll flee faster than
you can say "vasaaq"!
Of course, I've mastered the art of
stealth. <sp:5:0:0>I can easily sneak up on them
very, very slowly...
talk0027:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Even if you manage to get hold of a wild
sand seal...

the moment you let those reins drop, that
sand seal is done with you and heading
for the dunes!
Most folks don't want to go through all
the trouble, so they just rent one instead.
talk0028:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I hope the <clr:0000>sand shroud<clr:ffff> clears up soon.
I can't make a living if I can't rent out
sand seals...
talk0000:
<sp:3:0:2:0400>I guess it is true. I'd heard the guards
talking about it, but I still didn't believe a
voe was actually here.
I'm impressed. You made it all the way
here, through the sand shroud...

<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Notice_00>Oh! <sp:5:1:0>Did you rent a sand seal to get here?
talk0001:
My mom and I are in the business of
training sand seals and renting them out
to folks!
talk0030:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:SurpriseS>Are you sure you'll be OK without
a sand seal?
Talk_1013:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>The sand seals we rent out are strong,
loyal, and most important of all...<sp:5:1:0>CUTE!

If you're planning on going out into the
desert, please rent one to take with you!<sp:5:1:0>
You won't regret it!
Talk_1014:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Don't they just look so happy now that
they're back up on the surface?

After being down in the shelter for so
long, is it any wonder that they're full of
energy and ready to go?
They're more excited than ever to go skirt
across the dunes!
talk0004:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Ease_00>The <clr:0000>sand seals <clr:ffff>can sense the unease in
the air, so I'm trying to give them
constant attention and care.
I'm not too worried about the ones
here—they're plenty safe.

<sp:3:0:2:0c01>It's the <clr:0000>wild sand seals<clr:ffff> out in the desert
I'm worried about. I hope they're OK in
the sand shroud...
Talk_1015:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Renting a sand seal costs <clr:0000>20 rupees<clr:ffff>.
Or, if you're interested in a sleigh seal—
a sand seal with a sleigh—it's <clr:0000>50 rupees<clr:ffff>!
talk0005:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:TalkPositive>All you have to do is guide the <clr:0000>sand seal<clr:ffff>
in the direction you want to go. It's easy!

Oh, and you'll need a <clr:0000>shield<clr:ffff> when you
surf, so don't forget to equip one.
talk0006:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>This is my sand-seal rental shop. You can
rent a sand seal from me here!

Sand seals can breeze through the desert
with ease and are an essential way to
get around!
And all my trained ones have been
cooped up in the shelter for a while, so
they're full of energy and ready to go!
talk0007:
The sand shroud has made it far too
dangerous to go aboveground right
now, so my shop is temporarily closed...
<sp:3:0:2:0801>But if you've got questions about sand
seals, I'd be happy to answer them!
talk0008:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Wakeup_01>That customer seemed to be having a really rough
time. I wish there was some way I could help...

But if she doesn't even know where she wants to go,
there isn't much I can do.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk0009:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Wakeup_01>Last I saw, she was still near the <clr:0000>east gate<clr:ffff>. That
means she probably hasn't been able to find a map...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_11:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>If you're not sure what to do, why not
just rent one and see how it goes?
talk0010:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Sarqso!


In that case, you must have stopped at
the shop my mom runs near the entrance
to the desert!
talk0011:
<sp:3:0:2:0400>If you go for a casual stroll in the desert
at this time of day, you'll overheat in
no time!
